text: The Cathedral of Solsona is a cathedral in Solsona, Catalonia, Spain. The apse, in Roman style, probably dates from the twelfth century.The Catholic Encyclopedia ed. Charles George Herbermann - 1912 "The cathedral of Solsona is dedicated to the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin; the apse, in Roman style, dates probably from the twelfth century, the facade is Baroque ..." ==References== * Monestirs de Catalunya. Catedral de Solsona ==Other websites== Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Spain Category:Buildings and structures in Catalonia Category:12th-century buildings and structures
title: Solsona Cathedral
